thread.title: Pat Sajak, big Los Angeles Dodgers fan, is scared of the Mets
thread.title_full: Pat Sajak, big Los Angeles Dodgers fan, is scared of the Mets | NJ.com

author: Mike Vorkunov | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Pat Sajak, big Los Angeles Dodgers fan, is scared of the Mets
text:
NEW YORK — Is it bulletin board material if it's Pat Sajak saying he's scared of the Mets ?
Sajak, the host of Wheel of Fortune, is apparently a big Dodgers fan and he's got some fears about the Mets in this National League Division Series .
Actually, he's just scared of the Mets.
"Yes."
Sajak went on the Sports Zone with Pete McCarthy on 710 WOR and talked Mets-Dodgers some and he seems like he's a pretty knowledgeable fan (although he loses fan points for jumping ship from the Cubs). He offered as good a take on previewing this series as any we've seen.
RELATED: Mets NLDS playoff roster projection 3.0: Are Jon Niese and Juan Uribe on? "There are two words they have to worry about are Kershaw and Greinke," Sajak said of the Mets.
"It's baseball. Anything can happen but look it's a daunting task."
Oh how right he is. The Mets will face Clayton Kershaw and Zack Greinke in Games 1 and 2 and that's as impossible as it gets in baseball. They'll have Jacob deGrom and Noah Syndergaard going, hoping they can pitch them even.
Sajak actually offered a pretty apt comparison to these Dodgers: the 2001 Diamondbacks.
"The Dodgers remind me of the Diamondbacks when they won — (Curt) Schilling and (Randy) Johnson and not much after that," he said.
That Arizona team happened to win the 2001 World Series, beating the Yankees in one of the most epic World Series rounds in baseball history.
We'll see how far the Dodgers can get, though. Game 1 is Friday night at 9:45 p.m. ET.
